block.p: DEBT * Connecticut Health and Educational Facility Authority is offering $23.3 million in hospital revenue bonds initially priced to yield a maximum 6.65 percent for a bond due in 2006 through underwriters led by Merrill Lynch & Co. Yields on shorter maturities range from 4.50 percent in 1992 to 6.30 percent in 2002. The bond issue is for a Stamford Hospital project and is insured by the Municipal Bond Investor's Assurance Corp., giving the securities a triple-A rating by both Moody's and S.&P. * Lee County, Fla., is offering $35.6 million in tax-exempt capital and transportation facilities revenue bonds initially priced to yield a maximum 6.90 percent for a bond due 2011 through underwriters led by Smith Barney, Harris Upham & Co. Yields on shorter maturities range from 5.70 percent in 1996 to 6.20 percent in 2001 and 6.60 percent in 2005. The financing is insured by the Municipal Bond Investor's Assurance Corp. and rated triple-A by both Moody's and S.&P. * Whirlpool Corp., Benton Harbor, Mich., has filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission for a shelf offering of up to $500 million in debt securities and warrants through Goldman, Sachs & Co. COMMON STOCK * Pier 1 Imports Inc., Fort Worth, has filed for a public offering of nine million common shares through Smith Barney, Harris Upham & Co.
